006
007package renderer.models_F;
008
009import renderer.scene.*;
010import renderer.scene.primitives.*;
011
012/**
013   Create a wireframe model of a regular dodecahedron
014   with its center at the origin, having edge length
015   <pre>{@code
016     2*(sqrt(5)-1)/(1+sqrt(5)) = (1/2)*(sqrt(5)-1)^2 = 0.7639,
017   }</pre>
018   and with its vertices on a sphere of radius
019   <pre>{@code
020     2*sqrt(3)/(1+sqrt(5)) = 1.0705.
021   }</pre>
022<p>
023   See <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Regular_dodecahedron" target="_top">
024                https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Regular_dodecahedron</a>
025
026   @see Tetrahedron
027   @see Cube
028   @see Octahedron
029   @see Icosahedron
030*/
031public class Dodecahedron extends Model
032{
033   /**
034      Create a regular dodecahedron with its center at
035      the origin, having edge length
036      <pre>{@code
037        2*(sqrt(5)-1)/(1+sqrt(5)) = (1/2)*(sqrt(5)-1)^2 = 0.7639,
038      }</pre>
039      and with its vertices on a sphere of radius
040      <pre>{@code
041        2*sqrt(3)/(1+sqrt(5)) = 1.0705.
042     }</pre>
043   */
044   public Dodecahedron()
045   {
046      super("Dodecahedron");
047
048      // Create the dodecahedron's geometry.
049      // It has 20 vertices and 30 edges.
050      final double t = (1 + Math.sqrt(5))/2,   // golden ratio
051                   r = 1/t,
052                  r2 = r * r;
053      //https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Regular_dodecahedron#Cartesian_coordinates
054      // (±r, ±r, ±r)
055      addVertex(new Vertex(-r, -r, -r),
056                new Vertex(-r, -r,  r),
057                new Vertex(-r,  r, -r),
058                new Vertex(-r,  r,  r),
059                new Vertex( r, -r, -r),
060                new Vertex( r, -r,  r),
061                new Vertex( r,  r, -r),
062                new Vertex( r,  r,  r));
063
064      // (0, ±r2, ±1)
065      addVertex(new Vertex( 0, -r2, -1),
066                new Vertex( 0, -r2,  1),
067                new Vertex( 0,  r2, -1),
068                new Vertex( 0,  r2,  1));
069
070      // (±r2, ±1, 0)
071      addVertex(new Vertex(-r2, -1,  0),
072                new Vertex(-r2,  1,  0),
073                new Vertex( r2, -1,  0),
074                new Vertex( r2,  1,  0));
075
076      // (±1, 0, ±r2)
077      addVertex(new Vertex(-1,  0, -r2),
078                new Vertex( 1,  0, -r2),
079                new Vertex(-1,  0,  r2),
080                new Vertex( 1,  0,  r2));
081/*
082      // These vertices create a dodecahedron with vertices
083      // on a sphere of radius sqrt(3), and with edge length
084      //    2/t = 4/(1 + sqrt(5)) = sqrt(5) - 1 = 1.2361.
085      //https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Regular_dodecahedron#Cartesian_coordinates
086      // (±1, ±1, ±1)
087      addVertex(new Vertex(-1, -1, -1),
088                new Vertex(-1, -1,  1),
089                new Vertex(-1,  1, -1),
090                new Vertex(-1,  1,  1),
091                new Vertex( 1, -1, -1),
092                new Vertex( 1, -1,  1),
093                new Vertex( 1,  1, -1),
094                new Vertex( 1,  1,  1));
095
096      // (0, ±r, ±t)
097      addVertex(new Vertex( 0, -r, -t),
098                new Vertex( 0, -r,  t),
099                new Vertex( 0,  r, -t),
100                new Vertex( 0,  r,  t));
101
102      // (±r, ±t, 0)
103      addVertex(new Vertex(-r, -t,  0),
104                new Vertex(-r,  t,  0),
105                new Vertex( r, -t,  0),
106                new Vertex( r,  t,  0));
107
108      // (±t, 0, ±r)
109      addVertex(new Vertex(-t,  0, -r),
110                new Vertex( t,  0, -r),
111                new Vertex(-t,  0,  r),
112                new Vertex( t,  0,  r));
113*/
114      // Create 12 faces.
115//https://github.com/mrdoob/three.js/blob/master/src/geometries/DodecahedronGeometry.js
116      addPrimitive(new Face( 3, 11,  7, 15, 13),
117                   new Face( 7, 19, 17,  6, 15),
118                   new Face(17,  4,  8, 10,  6),
119                   new Face( 8,  0, 16,  2, 10),
120                   new Face( 0, 12,  1, 18, 16),
121                   new Face( 6, 10,  2, 13, 15),
122                   new Face( 2, 16, 18,  3, 13),
123                   new Face(18,  1,  9, 11,  3),
124                   new Face( 4, 14, 12,  0,  8),
125                   new Face(11,  9,  5, 19,  7),
126                   new Face(19,  5, 14,  4, 17),
127                   new Face( 1, 12, 14,  5,  9));
128   }
129}//Dodecahedron
